name: Pope Honorius III
summary: Honorius III, born Cencio Savelli, was Pope from 1216 to 1227. He succeeded Innocent III and worked to continue his predecessor's policies. He approved the Dominican and Franciscan orders, both of which had been established during Innocent III's pontificate. He called for the Fifth Crusade and worked to organize it. He also worked to implement the decisions of the Fourth Lateran Council. He was known for his administrative abilities and his support of the new mendicant orders.
